_localizedContents._text: It’s a sunny day, and you've gone out for errands. You happened to run into your friend, Emily, and so you decided to stop at the nearby park to chat for a while.
…and she won’t do it, not even after we’ve explained to her that times have changed. She just says that she’s “always done it this way before”.
Right, that’s the thing, when you’ve gotten so used to things being a certain way, it’s hard to accept any change.
Grandma can be pretty stubborn.
Yeah, that must be frustrating. She should trust your reasoning at this point.
Can you even expect her to change at her age?
But most people aren’t willing to reconsider their views, not just old grannies!
You’re right, most people are just stubborn, in general.
C’mon, that’s not always the case…
I know, right! At least you and I agree.
As if! It’s the case the majority of the time, and you know it.
It’s such a waste to try and convince people. Everyone has their own views and they’re always so quick to defend them they don’t even question whether they are actually right.
You sit still for a while, the momentum of your conversation having slowed.Then, you’re hit by a terrible, burning smell; that of a cigarette.
You both turn around: just a few meters from you is a man holding a short cigarette. He inhales one last time, and then discards the end by absent-mindedly throwing it to the ground.
You both turn around: just a few meters from you is a man holding a short cigarette. He inhales one last time, and then discards the end by absent-mindedly throwing it to the ground.
Yeah, some people are just jerks.
Maybe he just didn’t see it. I’ll go talk to him and see what’s up.
You get up and approach the smoker.
Excuse me sir, if you need an ashtray, you can find one on every bin in the park.You really shouldn’t throw your cigarettes in the grass like that.
The smoker barely raises his gaze from his phone.
[Leave him alone]
Yes sir, I’m talking to you. Improperly discarded cigarettes can have devastating effects on an ecosystem. It’s irresponsible of you to leave them on the ground.
Mind your business, dude.
The smoker leaves, putting his hands in his pockets. You watch as various wrappers carelessly fall to the ground in the process.
Defeated, you walk back to Emily.
Nice try, but what did you expect? You can’t talk to a person who doesn’t want to hear. If he really cared about this, he would’ve been more careful in the first place.
He’s just a jerk!
It was worth a shot.
Yeah, right. It’s getting pretty late; we should head back now.
She gets up and you both start following the path to the park exit.
You reach the park exit. On the ground lies an electric scooter, diagonally blocking the path. Walking towards it, you pass a teenage girl sitting on a bench.
Careful. Some kid left their scooter in the middle of the road. People who use these things never put them away properly!
You notice the teenage girl perking up at Nima’s loud comment, but you don’t stop.
It’s just a shame that people don’t bother to care. What if an old lady wanted to go for a stroll in the park? She might stumble over that thing.
And I bet if we tried to move it, its owner would come out and start yelling at us.
We could’ve moved it out of the way.
I suppose. But if it was that teenage girl’s, she might overreact. You know how they are.
You’re probably right.
Then we’ll explain to her what we’re doing and why.
Like she’s ever going to listen! She's a teenager.
Yeah, teenagers are a headache...
It just means she’s got plenty to learn! Maybe we should try to set a good example for once.
Suit yourself! But it’s not going to work, trust me. People don’t just change their minds because you kindly asked them to.
Just stay here then, I’ll do it myself.
Why are you so against even giving it a try? What’s there to lose?
Because it won’t matter! So what’s the point? You’re just wasting your energy. If you care too much all the time, you’ll only keep on being disappointed.
You’re never getting anywhere with that mindset.
But you need to care if you want things to get better. And it seems to me you do care indeed.
I’m going back.
We have to start somewhere, and doing so from a place of care seems like a good idea. C’mon, let’s go.
You both walk back into the park.
You go back into the park on your own.
The teenage girl looks at you and makes to get up.
You walk up to the misplaced scooter. You pick it up and start moving it to the side of the path, not too far from where it used to be lying.
Hey! That's mine!
Then you shouldn’t have left it here.
I’m just moving it. It was blocking the path.
So what? Just walk over it.
And what if an old lady comes by? She might not be able to.
Right, but imagine if I had a scooter of my own! It’d be annoying to have to get on the grass to go around it - I’m sure you understand.
Hah! That’d be her problem for being old.
Oh, I guess so.
Keep that in mind for the future, okay?
That’s why I’m moving it; so that nobody has to get dirty to pass.
Sure, whatever.
I see. Hold on, let me get it.
$scooterGirl = 2
$scooterGirl = 1
She gets up and repositions the scooter herself.
You thank her politely, and leave.
You done? Can we go now?
$emilySees == 1
$emilySees == 2
$emilySees = 1
$emilySees = 2
$emilySees = 3
$scooterGirl == 1
$scooterGirl == 2
Well at least she didn’t start fighting you over that.
Well what do you know, she really did listen. I guess you were right ...this time.
The two of you leave the park, and then wave each other goodbye as you split up. As you walk back home, you can’t help but feel as if both of you failed to learn something from the events of today….
The two of you leave the park, and then stop to wave each other goodbye as you’re about to split up to go your separate ways.
You know… you’re right. I do care.
But it’s just so hard to keep caring when so many others don’t.
But you have to! Stop moping and be an example.
But some do. And others can, under the right circumstances.
Yeah, yeah, I know. I really should.
But you should have a little more tact...
I suppose. But you have to be willing to explain! Only then can the other become willing to listen.
$scooterGirl == 1
$scooterGirl == 2
I think that girl would’ve reacted better if only you’d had a little more tact.
I guess we both have a lot to learn, don’t we?
You took the right approach with that girl.
I think I could learn something from you.
…just this once.
THE END.

$smoker == 2
Like she’s ever going to listen! You saw it before, that guy didn’t even want to hear your reasoning! And this one is a teenager.
Yeah, teenagers are a headache...
It just means she’s got plenty to learn! Maybe we should try to set a good example for once.
Ciao a tutti...
Hi All
A tut le monde
General
